newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedes more optimistic on economy for next year.
newsitem.headline: Swedes more optimistic on economy for next year.

text.p: The number of Swedes believing the general economic situation in Sweden will improve over the next 12 months increased by one percent in July, Statistics Sweden (SCB) said on Friday.
Those who think the situation will deteriorate decreased by one percent, SCB's monthly consumer buying expectation poll found.
However the number of Swedes believing their own households economy would improve slipped by one percent while the number believing in households' economies worsening fell by two percent.
Four percent less people thought unemployment would increase over the next 12 months.
Prices were expected to increase 1.8 percent over the next year compared to the previous month's expectation of 1.3 percent.

The Consumer Confidence Index, which is the average of percentages on views about the economy, household economies and purchases of capital goods, was unchanged from June at 3 compared to minus 12 in July last year.
